product_title: AMZCHEF Portable Induction Cooktop 20 Temperature & Power Levels, 1800W Induction Stove Burner with 6.8" Heating Coil, Low Noise Hot Plate Single Electric Cooktops Countertop Stove with Timer
about_product: [20 POWER & TEMPERATURE LEVELS] Experience the epitome of control with 20 adjustable power levels, from a gentle 90W to a robust 1800W, and 20 precise temperature settings ranging from a delicate 120°F to a searing 465°F. With this level of precision, achieving culinary perfection is no longer a challenge. The portable induction cooktop allows you to cook more quickly and doesn’t use as much energy as other cooktops.

[EFFICIENT INDUCTION COOKTOP] The 1800W induction burner provides outstanding performance with its impressive power capacity, allowing for rapid heating compared to traditional cooktops. This not only accelerates meal preparation but also contributes to lower energy consumption, resulting in cost savings on your utility bills. Its portability makes it an excellent option for cooking in places without a standard stove, such as an office break room.

[HANDY PRESET MENU] The induction stove is designed for effortless cooking, featuring a smart responsive touchscreen interface and 4 preset cooking functions for boiling water, hot pot, stew, and heat preservation. This induction cooker seamlessly combines convenience and speed, elevating your cooking experience with its exceptional features and user-friendly design.

[CONVENIENT INDUCTION STOVE]The induction burner has been carefully crafted with your safety and convenience as the top priority. It includes a safety lock function to prevent accidental touch and a waste heat reminder to minimize the risk of burns, providing you with peace of mind. Moreover, its timer function allows you to effectively oversee your cooking process, guaranteeing the optimal quality of your culinary creations.

[PORTABLE INDUCTION BURNER]The induction cooktop is thoughtfully engineered to accommodate from 4" to 10" pans with magnetic bottoms and is optimized for use in 110 to 120V environments, meeting the standards of North American households. The sleek black ceramic glass panel not only exudes sophistication but also ensures durability and effortless cleaning. Measuring 13.8"*11.0"*1.8", this induction cooker is lightweight and only 5.5 pounds, making it the perfect addition to your kitchen.

product_videos.title: Everything you need to know before buying
AMZCHEF Portable Induction Cooktop 20 Temperature & Power Levels
Honest Review- AMZCHEF Portable Induction Cooktop
AMZCHEF Portable Induction Cooktop Honest Review!

customers_say: Customers find the induction cooktop works well and heats up quickly, with one mentioning it boils water in two minutes. They appreciate its ease of use, quality, and multiple power settings. The temperature control receives mixed feedback - while it gets hot quickly, some find the temperature mode useless. The noise level is also mixed, with some finding it not very noisy while others note it makes some noise.

top_reviews.review_comment: Initial review - I won't be addressing reliability over time as this item is new to me. This is an improvement over my 5+ year old induction plate. Things I like: 1) the temperature monitoring of the cookware being heated seems more responsive. My previous induction cooktop would begin to boil small amounts of water even with the temperature set to 140 degrees, at least for a couple minutes, before reducing power to maintain 140 degrees. 2) while the cooling fan inside the unit is certainly not silent, is isn't as loud as my older unit and seems to have multiple speeds - higher when the power or temperature is higher, slower (slightly less sound) when the power or temperature are lower, slow during the cool-down period. 3) the readout shows 'hot' when the surface has been heated by hot cookware on top - in the time between uses, I now know if the surface has cooled. There are a good number of function options, so your choices may take a few button presses to accomplish. They are mostly easy to learn - not a problem if you actually want a good number of presets and options. If this unit remains reliable, I won't need to return for an edit :-)
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2025

top_reviews.review_title: This is easy and convenient to use.
top_reviews.review_comment: My kitchen has a gas oven, which makes the room really hot in the summer, and if the heat isn’t controlled well, pots can burn or get too hot to handle. That’s why I bought this induction cooktop, and it’s been great. It has multiple power settings and modes for things like boiling water or cooking, plus a timer function. It boils water quickly, cooks noodles faster, and I love that the handles don’t get hot at all. Some reviews mentioned it can be noisy, but compared to other appliances I own, it’s not that loud. I also like that it’s slimmer and lighter than similar models.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: Very happy with this purchase. Build quality and surface space is nice, heats up very quick, no issues, no unreasonable fan noise. Definitely good value for the money, we'll packaged and received on time. Get you one and get to cooking.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: The best feature of induction cooktops is that they don't heat up the kitchen, and in hot weather that is important. As everybody says, you get fast cooking and fast cool off. I threw out my old electric stove and got two induction cooktops, different brand and color, and they look so nice and modern on a SS kitchen table.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: I like the convenience of the unit. I have been using a 8" cast iron pan. Everything heats up fast. If I were to think about a disappointment, it would be that the heat concentrates on about 4" in the center, I was expecting the heat to be more distributed through out the pan. Maybe placing some info on the top for temperature ranges and relating it to the stove dial indicating from simmer to mid to high might be helpful. Gary
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: So helpful to have another surface when there is a lot of traffic on the kitchen. This cooktop has been a great addition to my daily life, works really well and cut the cooking time to the half. Super easy to carry around and the size is perfect to store it on any spot. The glass surface is easy to clean. I’m really happy with this purchase.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2025

top_reviews.review_title: Don't like the unit I got, maybe its defective, or the operational characteristics are
top_reviews.review_comment: This item heats very unevenly. I have tried two separate skillets, and the unit only heats up in the upper left quadrant. The lower left doesn't produce much, or any heat. I have turned both skillets in various directions, always with the same result. Drop an egg in the upper half and it will fry up quickly, drop one in the lower portion, and it basically just sits there. Does the same when I cooked some hamburgers, and pancakes. After the grease should be sufficiently hot, flicking some water in it gives a definite response in the upper quadrant, but little reaction in the other half. The instructions are uninformative. Perhaps I am doing something wrong, but I never had a similar problem with a gas stove/burner. I don't like the conventional electric burners, because they tend to warp, and the skillets/pots have to be set off of the burners because they retain heat, which this thing requires also. The choices/options for cooking are far more 'sophisticated' than necessary, and choosing the wrong option may be part of the problem I'm having, but there is nothing I've found that even addresses my problem with this device.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2025

top_reviews.review_comment: Works great and fast. Easy to operate.
top_reviews.review_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2025

top_reviews_global.review_title: Simple, safe and efficient, happy with this purchase
top_reviews_global.review_comment: This induction cooktop works well for my needs. It heats up quickly. I like that it does not have an open flame and makes it safer when cooking around kids. The controls are easy to use and the timer is a helpful feature. It does not take up much space and storing it is no problem. My wife also likes it enough that she wants to get another one for our rental unit. Overall, it is a good and practical cooktop for everyday use.

top_reviews_global.review_title: No es silenciosa sólo hace un 20% menos de ruido, pero es mas delgada.
top_reviews_global.review_comment: La compré porque me molesta el ruido que hacen todas con el ventilador de enfriamiento y una reseña decía que era silenciosa y no es cierto. Lo que me gusta es que es un poco mas delgada pero creo que para el precio hay mas baratas que hacen lo mismo.

Really useful inductive stove which works great. I waited for a few months before reviewing in case it broke or didn't deliver what it promises. I mostly use it for heating water fast in a pan for making tea, etc. It is very rapid at heating. Also provides various other heating functions (which I haven't really used to be honest as I have a new oven now). Doesn't take up much room either, when not in use I stow it under a kitchen cabinet and cover with a tea towel!. Recommended.
Works well! Water boils quickly! Lots of different cooking options, which makes it convenient for your liking.

top_reviews_global.review_title: Works very quickly and is much better than my gas cooktop.
top_reviews_global.review_comment: Works really well. Even a couple of pots that I was unsure would respond to induction because they seemed poorly magnetic worked perfectly fine with this induction unit. It heats up so quickly and responds to changes in temperature settings quickly. I much prefer it to our gas cooktop and use it every day. I just wish more of my pots were induction compatible particularly my pressure cooker. I use it every day for a steamer for my plant based milks for my coffee and it is better than gas because it keeps the heat up without the heat coming around the side of the pot which burns my hands when I am steaming the milk. I just used it to make a batch of beer and it heats a 5 gallon pot of water in about 15 minutes whereas my gas cooktop struggles with that volume. I can also take it outside and cook my beer in the garage which makes for a more harmonious domestic situation. I love this thing.
